DOC.brief_summary: Recently, a lot of evidence for a relation between measures of cognitive performance and personality characteristics has been collected. The use of computer based latency measures is often used to study mental processes in cognitive, as well as, in personality research On the basis of these relationships we can ask a question that relates to the practical usefulness (validity) of processing speed, accuracy of performance and personality measures in predicting impulsive behavior.
DOC.brief_title: The Influence of Personality on Two Aspects of Cognitive Performance: Processing Speed, and Accuracy.
DOC.criteria: Men and women at age 2050 years History of psychiatric disorders, previous hospitalizations and psychopharmacological treatments History of alcohol and substance abuse
DOC.keyword: the practical usefulness (validity) of processing speed, accuracy of performance and personality measures in predicting impulsive behavior
